name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: Millions of people have benefited from the medical advances and protections derived from Henrietta Lacks‚Äô cells. I‚Äôm proud to help lead this effort with Senator @ChrisVanHollen to award the Congressional Gold Medal in recognition of the tremendous impact of her life and legacy. https://t.co/fcK9c9GIUd

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text:
Read more on the legacy of Henrietta Lacks here:
https://t.co/UcAY2UGmdf

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: The whole world has benefitted from Henrietta Lacks, including the development of U.S. privacy laws in health care. I am proud to work for her and honor her with a Congressional Gold Medal.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text:
In 2013, after 62 years of research and 62 years since Lacks‚Äô death, Lacks‚Äô family was granted some control over how her genome was being used.
 
Lacks‚Äô story led to the rewriting of the rules around ethics in health care, including patient privacy and consent.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text:
Doctors found that Lacks‚Äô cells could thrive in a lab and were shipped around the world as the subject of 74k+ studies.
 
Her family did not know that her cells were alive or being used. The cells, called HeLa cells, laid the base for the multibillion-dollar biotech industry.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: In 1951, Henrietta Lacks was a young mother who went to The Johns Hopkins Hospital, one of the few hospitals that would care for poor Black Americans, to be treated for cancer. While there, health providers removed her cells without her knowledge or consent. https://t.co/2x4SD1nCBS

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: RT @ChrisVanHollen: The debt of gratitude we owe Henrietta Lacks can never be fully repaid. But we can work to right this historic wrong an‚Ä¶

name: Senator Ben Cardin

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: Ghost guns remain a large threat in our country. Due to the lack of serial numbers, law enforcement has a difficult time tracking down the owners of the ghost guns found at crime scenes. Last year, there were 20k ghost guns recovered by law enforcement in criminal investigations.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text:
Yesterday, @POTUS announced a new federal rule to crack down on ‚Äúghost guns.‚Äù Many might not know what ghost guns are.

A ghost gun is a gun that can be bought online, assembled at home and has no serial number, making it an untraceable firearm.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: This legislation would take a meaningful step in undoing the harmful legacy of past infrastructure projects that have hindered the economic development and mobility of disadvantaged communities. It also recognizes the importance of community engagement and planning.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: By removing burdensome #transportation barriers, we can reconnect communities to opportunities, improve health and safety, and make daily life better. I'm proud to join @SenatorCarper in sponsoring the Reconnecting Communities Act, which do just that.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: Rather than connecting their communities and expanding their opportunities, highway construction brought demolition, displacement, isolation, and exclusion. According to one estimate, the federal highway system, between 1956 and 1967, displaced more than 300,000 households.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: Our national hwy system, built in the 1950s was a great achievement‚Äîa major public investment in infrastructure, transforming our country. We rely on it today. But for too many, especially communities of color, the construction of our hwys had traumatic and destructive impacts.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: We are long overdue in taking hard look at how our federal #transportation policy can help address the challenge of inequity‚Äîthe exclusion of disadvantaged communities and communities of color. Baltimore City is intimately familiar with this painful history of highway planning.

name: Senator Ben Cardin
tweet_text: Starting now. My 1st hearing as chair of the @EPWCmte Transportation & Infrastructure Subcommittee. We're taking a look at "Equity in Transportation Infrastructure: Connecting Communities, Removing Barriers, and Repairing Networks across America.‚Äù Live: https://t.co/SI4u1oW3DK
